Night Shift's expression turns grim, as does Rat Trap's.  They look at each=
 other and then back at the ground.  Realizing the danger, Night Shift poin=
ts to the lava flow.

" This isn't good, the prints in the ground, definite=
ly Unicronian.  That means Cheetor's nowhere around here now, he was, got d=
amaged, but someone picked 'em up.  But now, we don't have time ta hang aro=
und, because once that lava flow hits us, we're gone."

Rat Trap nodds.

"Y=
eah, best that we get outa here, and report what we found so far?"

Night S=
hift nodds.

"We'll do that, but we're not givn' up on Cheetor just yet.  W=
e know the signatures are Unicronian, so I think I'm gonna try'n keep monit=
oring that while we're on the move.  First things first though, we gotta bu=
rn rubber and get back ta safer ground."

Rat Trap realized that Night Shif=
t was talking vehicle.

"Wait, you turn ta your wheels now and if you blow =
a tire we're done for anyway."

Night Shift sighs and transforms.

"Yeah we=
ll, can't be avoided.  C'mon, we're outa here.  Fastest way ta safe ground.=
"

Rat Trap gets in and buckles himself in the driver's seat.

"I sure hope=
 you got good tires buddy."

Night Shift replies.

"Yeah, I'm good, tranny'=
s workn' suspension's up ta snuff, we're as good as outa here.  No worries,=
 I got four wheel drive, we'll make it outa here."

He starts to roll in th=
e opposite direction, hoping to get himself and Rat Trap to saftey while st=
ill tracking the Unicronian signature, hoping to find its origin.

> The remaining part of the tri=
p continues to get hotter and hotter as they

tower stood. Nightshift and Rat Trap's internal

them that they have found the spot where Cheetor
> had stood.

> This are=
a is still untouched by the lava itself. However it is still
> spreading ou=
t across the landscape of this area and will soon envelope even
> this area=
 soon. It would seem that the volcano beneath the tower that
> Hydras' base=
 stood upon is quite active once set into motion.
>

uld make out there was some sort of firefight, the
> scorched and burned re=
sidue of laser fire were clearly evident in the
> surrounding soils and roc=
ks. Cheetor took off at a run away from the area,
> this evident by the wid=
ely spaced foot prints.

Cheetor, using his speed and
> agility had managed to avoid his attackers f=
or quite some time. But then
> Nightshift spots a bit of mech fluid on the =
ground. Cheetor had been hit.
> 
> The tracks lead to another secluded spot=
 where Cheetor put up a fight,
> judging by the burns and scorches along th=
e ground. But then there is the
> imprint of Cheetor's body on the ground. =
From the looks of things it say
> there for quite some time, judging by the=
 depth of it.
> 
> Strangely enough there are other prints on the ground, s=
harps clawed feet
> that seemed to appear from no where. There is no path o=
f them coming up to
> the site where Cheetor lay, nor of them leaving. But =
from the evidence the
> large reptile picked up Cheetor and most likely fle=
w off with him.
> 
> A complete scan of the area reveals something interest=
ing, the slight
> signature of something that was unicronian in origin. Wha=
t ever it was that
> carried away Cheetor, it may not have been Decepticon =
or Predacon.

here they were
